terms.definition: Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a service provider and accessed via the internet
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions
Standard Operating Procedures - detailed written instructions that describe how to perform routine tasks or processes consistently
A feature that allows multiple users to simultaneously edit and collaborate on the same document in real-time
A security method that restricts system access and permissions based on the user's role within an organization
Good Manufacturing Practices - a set of regulations and guidelines that ensure products are consistently produced and controlled according to quality standards
The collection and evaluation of data to establish scientific evidence that a process consistently produces results meeting predetermined specifications
Documentation that is properly organized, complete, and easily accessible for regulatory inspections and compliance reviews
The process of moving a developed process or technology from one environment to another, typically from development to manufacturing
Groups of people with different functional expertise working together toward a common goal or project
The adherence to laws, regulations, guidelines, and specifications relevant to an organization's business processes
Failure Mode and Effects Analysis - a systematic method for evaluating processes to identify where and how they might fail and assessing the relative impact of different failures
Manufacturing processes that use biological systems, living organisms, or their components to produce commercial products
A cloud-based software solution that enables organizations to create, manage, store, and share documentation electronically
